body.p: IAS 19 as revised in 1998 defined plan assets as assets (other than non‑transferable financial instruments issued by the reporting entity) held by an entity (a fund) that satisfies all of the following conditions:

li.p: The entity is legally separate from the reporting entity.

The assets of the fund are to be used only to settle the employee benefit obligations, are not available to the entity’s own creditors and cannot be returned to the entity (or can be returned to the entity only if the remaining assets of the fund are sufficient to meet the plan’s obligations).
To the extent that sufficient assets are in the fund, the entity will have no legal or constructive obligation to pay the related employee benefits directly.
